title: Bangkok bomb aimed at tourism industry, says prime minister
text:
Bangkok bomb aimed at tourism industry, says prime minister 18 August 2015 Save 
The prime minister of Thailand has said yesterday’s deadly bomb attack in Thailand was targeted at the country’s tourism industry. 
The attack, which has killed at least 20 people, took place near the Erawan Hindu shrine, which is popular with tourists. 
It went off at 7.00pm local time when the area was crowded according to the BBC . 
“This is the worst incident that has ever happened in Thailand,” said Prayuth Chan-ocha. 
“There have been minor bombs or just noise, but this time they aim for innocent lives. They want to destroy our economy, our tourism.” 
The UK Foreign Office has updated its travel advice following the attack. 
“The British Embassy is in contact with local authorities. You should monitor news reports, follow the advice of local authorities and take extra care,” it said. 
As well as the 22 casualties, there are more than 120 injured people. 
In a statement on its website the Tourism Authority of Thailand said: “The Royal Thai Police have requested that locals and tourists exercise caution when out and about in Bangkok. 
“The police have also increased their presence and put extra security in place at all of Bangkok’s key tourist areas in response to the incident.”
